scene.credits: (bkgd)Comstock/PunchStock, (c)James Woodson/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (others)VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images

hotspots.hotspot:
Key

The key shows that the green shading represents significant events, the yellow shading shows periods of declining unemployment, and the blue numbers represent the total number of unemployed workers.

X-Axis

The horizontal axis is also called the x-axis. On this graph, it shows dates from 1920 to 1945.

Y-Axis

The vertical axis is also called the y-axis. On this graph, it shows the percentage of nonfarm workers who are unemployed.

Event 1

The first event on the graph is the stock market crash of 1929. The unemployment rate increases dramatically in the years following this crash. Also note that the unemployment level did not jump to nearly 38% right away.

Event 2

The second event shown on the graph is the election of Franklin Roosevelt to the office of president in 1932. His "New Deal" programs caused the unemployment rate to drop.

Event 3

A recession in 1937 caused an increase in the unemployment rate. Analyze the graph to determine what caused the unemployment rate to drop following that recession.

multiple.question: Based on the information in the graph, which of the following was the most successful in ending unemployment?

answers.answer: The New Deal programs
World War II

hotspots.hotspot: The label and increments on the x-axis show that the information on this graph is organized by year, and in ten-year increments.
This label explains how the data is presented on the y-axis. The population figures are presented in the thousands.

The key explains that the blue-colored bars represent the white population of the area and the orange-colored bars represent the black population of the area. The key specifies that the graph does not include any data for the Native American population.

The white population grows by a multiple of more than four from 1630 to 1640, by a multiple of just over two from 1640 to 1650, and by a multiple of little over Â½ from 1650 to 1660. The rate of growth of the white population continues to slow down even though the white population keeps growing. Why?
After smaller rates of growth, the black population more than doubles from 1680 to 1690, and then almost doubles again from 1690 to 1700. Why?

multiple.question: Based on the information in the graph, what can you infer about the black population in the Chesapeake?

answers.answer: There was an increased need for enslaved Africans between 1680 and 1700.
More Africans moved to the Chesapeake area between 1680 and 1700 looking for religious freedom and economic opportunities.

scene.credits: (tr)VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (1)Stapleton Collection/Historical Picture Library/Corbis, (2)Historical Picture Archive/Corbis, (bkgd)Comstock/PunchStock

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: The increase in blacks in this area was higher than the increase of blacks in other colonies during this time.
The practice of indentured servitude ended around 1690.
English settlement became more established and permanent during this time.
Slavery became a significant characteristic of life in the Chesapeake region during this period.
The rise of slavery ended opportunities for future indentured servants.
The rising rate of increase for the black population in this area is related to the decreasing rate of increase for whites.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers'.

multiple.question: Puritan emigration decreased once England became a commonwealth because the Puritans enjoyed religious freedom during Cromwell's protectorate.

answers.answer: TRUE
FALSE

multiple.question: The restoration of the English monarchy sparked an increase in English migration to New England.

answers.answer: TRUE
FALSE

multiple.question: Why were the Irish among the most likely immigrant groups to become part of the industrial workforce?

answers.answer: Because most industries were located in large cities and most Irish immigrants did not have the money to move to smaller towns or buy land in America.
Because they had industrial skills and experience from working in factories in Ireland.

content.instruction:
What is the historical context of the data?

  • Why Germany?
  • Why Northern Europe?

hotspots.hotspot:
EUROPE IN 1848

People in Germany, France, Austria, and other countries were not satisfied with autocratic systems of government, and demanded wider participation in government and more democracy.

REVOLUTION IN GERMANY

A German grassroots movement, supported by nationalists, liberals, intellectuals, and workers, demanded a more democratic government, an end to political censorship, and lower taxes. The middle class focused on political goals, while the workers wanted better pay and working conditions. These differences would weaken the revolutionary cause.

NATIONAL EIGEN

In March 1848 in Berlin, the capital of Prussia, crowds of people gathered and demanded their rights. The protestors were attacked and hundreds were killed. This engraving shows the revolutionary crowds gathering together to see the writing on the wallâ"National Eigen" which means a nation of one's own.

AFTERMATH OF THE REVOLUTION

After a brief period of success, during which a newly elected national assembly tried to make changes, the Prussian ruler issued a monarchist constitution, crushing the hopes of reformers. This defeat caused many middle-class Germans and other Northern Europeans to immigrate to the United States.

multiple.question: Which of the following best describes the differences between Irish and German immigrants during this period?

answers.answer: The Irish Catholics sought freedom of worship in the United States, whereas the German protestants came for economic reasons.
The Germans had more money than Irish immigrants, and they moved away from the coast to areas in the Midwest and West.

multiple.question: What does the depiction of the immigrants in the cartoon say about the beliefs of some native-born Americans at that time?

answers.answer: Some native-born Americans worried that the large numbers of Irish and German immigrants would sway elections and become a political power.
Some native-born Americans worried that the drunken Irish and German immigrants would break into polling places and steal ballot boxes.

scene.credits: (tr)VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (inset)Peter Newark American Pictures/The Bridgeman Art Library, (bkgd)Comstock/PunchStock

content.instruction:
What does the data show?

  • Women in the Paid Workforce, 1900-1940

hotspots.hotspot:
X-AXIS

The x-axis shows that the data is presented by year, with benchmarks at each decade between 1900 and 1940.

Y-AXIS

The benchmarks on the y-axis organize the data by millions of total people in the paid workforce, from 0 to 60 million.

BLUE SHADING

The area shaded blue, topped by the blue line, shows the total number of people in the paid workforce in the United States. You can see a dramatic increase between 1900 and 1910, then a steady climb between 1910 and 1940. These figures include both men and women in the workforce.

ORANGE SHADING

The area shaded orange shows the total numbers of women in the paid workforce. The percentage at each decade shows the percentage of the total workforce that women represented at that time. Because the purple area represents single women in the workforce, you can conclude that the area between the purple line and the red line shows the numbers of married women in the workforce.

PURPLE SHADING

The purple-shaded area represents the number of single women in the paid workforce. Notice that the number of single women in the workplace dropped between 1920 and 1930, then rose again between 1930 and 1940.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: During this period, women had more opportunities to find professional and executive-level work.
Many New Deal programs provided jobs for married women.
As men were less able to provide for their families, women found it necessary to take paid work outside the home.
Women working outside the home affected how both women and men would view women's roles and possibilities in the future.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers'.

content.instruction: What is the historical context of the data?

hotspots.hotspot:
INCREASED IMMIGRATION

The numbers of immigrants between 1901 and 1915 were dramatically higher than in previous decades. Some people were bothered by the high number of immigrants and where those immigrants came from.

EASTERN EUROPEANS

Earlier immigrants to the United States had come primarily from Northwestern Europe, especially Germany, Britain, Ireland, and Scandinavia. However, the majority of the immigrants in the early 20th century were from Eastern European countries, as well as some Asians and Latin Americans.

ANTI-IMMIGRATION

Nativists wanted to protect the interests of what they considered the "native" peoples of America, which included people of British or Northeastern European heritage. The Eugenics movement was primarily concerned with protecting what they considered the racial purity of Anglo-Saxon and Nordic America.

PRO-IMMIGRATION

Those who supported immigration included immigrants themselves, their political representatives, and business owners who saw immigrants as a source of cheap labor.

WORLD WAR I

Immigration decreased sharply during World War I, which occurred between 1914 and 1918.

scene.credits: (tr)VisionsofAmerica/Joe Sohm/Digital Vision/Getty Images, (c)The Library of Congress, Prints ï¹ Photographs Division, (bkgd)Comstock/PunchStock

multiple.question: What is the meaning and significance of the data in these two graphs?

answers.answer: Political and economic tensions before World War I and better opportunities in the United States increased immigration.
World War I caused the number of immigrants to the United States from Europe to drop.

multiple.question: Based on the data in the table, which side was most likely to have a problem raising money to finance their armed forces?

answers.answer: Union
Confederacy

multiple.question: Why do you think "Corn and wheat production" is listed on this data table?

answers.answer: Because it illustrates the amount of cash crops each side could trade to gain international support.
Because it illustrates how much food reserves each side had so they can feed their army and civilians.

multiple.question: Most historians find data to be of limited value.

answers.answer: TRUE
FALSE

multiple.question: Bar and line graphs can show trends in data.

answers.answer: TRUE
FALSE

multiple.question: Historians can use data to recognize change over time.

answers.answer: TRUE
FALSE

multiple.question: Data cannot help reveal cause-and-effect relationships.

answers.answer: TRUE
FALSE

multiple.question: Historians often combine data and other primary or secondary resources to learn more about an event or time period.

answers.answer: TRUE
FALSE

multiple.question: Acts of Congress affected U.S. trade between 1805 and 1820.

answers.answer: TRUE
FALSE

multiple.question: Which statement is the most logical, based on the data presented on the graph?

answers.answer: There was a dramatic decrease in voter participation in the first two decades of the 20th century.
Many men decided not to vote because women were granted the right to vote in 1920.

multiple.question: Which statement is the most logical, based on the data presented on the graph?

answers.answer: The lower birth rate in the latter half of the 20th century will put stress on the Social Security system as the Baby Boomers retire.
In the latter half of the 20th century, both the birth rate and the average life span declined.

multiple.question: Which statement is the most logical, based on the data presented on the graph?

answers.answer: There was unrest and increased violence in Austria-Hungary in the period before World War I.
People of German heritage no longer represented a substantial voting block.

multiple.question: Which statement is the most logical, based on the data presented on the table?

answers.answer: The slave trade ended because there was no longer a need for enslaved workers.
Whites became increasingly nervous about possible violence from the enslaved African American population.
